title: Collecting Soil Samples | From the Ground Up

subtasks: Identify the need for a soil test due to lack of prior information
Prepare sample collection by soil depth (top four to six inches)
Dry the soil to proper consistency for mailing
Deposit soil into a quart bag, ensuring no plant material or organic debris
Secure and mail the soil sample to an agricultural lab
Contact the local extension office for assistance with sampling techniques or lab information
Explain the purpose of a soil test in determining fertilizer needs
Mention alternatives considered (e.g., fictional device from Men in Black)
Reinforce the necessity of sending soil samples to an expert lab for analysis
Credit the source (University of Wyoming Extension) and acknowledge the video's title (From the Ground Up)
